title: FMCPAY_GLOBAL
author: FMCPAY_GLOBAL
content: Meme-inspired cryptocurrency Dogecoin (DOGE) is now officially the second largest proof-of-work (PoW) crypto in terms of market cap, following the Ethereum network's proof-of-stake upgrade on Sept. 15. Bitcoin (BTC) of course remains miles ahead of Dogecoin’s market cap of $7.83 billion, though the well-followed memecoin is still comfortably ahead of the third place PoW cryptocurrency Ethereum Classic (ETC) (with a market cap of $4.69 billion), Litecoin (LTC)  ($4.01 billion) and Monero (XMR) ($2.65 billion).One Dogecoin fan appeared to be in disbelief of Dogecoin’s rise to become the second largest PoW cryptocurrency, stating “who would have thought that this would happen. Congrats #Dogefam.”(Source: Cointelegraph)

comments.author: Bananington
comments.body: You didn't say something of your own about the article you copied and pasted with the link, we expect a piece of what you think as well considering you started the topic. Dogecoin may soon become the first on PoW or second on PoS, depending on if bitcoins transition first or they do. If asked some months ago, I would have picked litecoins as the next to succeed ETH as second largest PoW, but here we are. The announcement however did not seem to have any major effect on the price of Dogecoin.

Dogecoin may soon become the first on PoW or second on PoS, depending on if bitcoins transition first or they do. If asked some months ago, I would have picked litecoins as the next to succeed ETH as second largest PoW, but here we are. The announcement however did not seem to have any major effect on the price of Dogecoin.There’s a link to the source attached to his thread coming from cointelegraph if you didn’t notice at the bottom part.The content explains well the title of the OP. I doubt that further speculation is required on making this kind of info type thread. Doge will never beat Bitcoin on top because Ethereum didn’t manage that task for many years of being number 2. I think the main question here is if Doge will pursue PoS too.

comments.author: Jackl87
comments.body: Quote from: FMCPAY_GLOBAL on September 16, 2022, 07:10:13 AMMeme-inspired cryptocurrency Dogecoin (DOGE) is now officially the second largest proof-of-work (PoW) crypto in terms of market cap, following the Ethereum network's proof-of-stake upgrade on Sept. 15. In general i think that the time of Proof-of-Work coin is coming to an end slowly but surely. Bitcoin will of course be an exception from that because i highly doubt, that they will also move to proof of stake in the future because bitcoin mining is just way to big of a business i think with mining farms in China having invested millions and millions of dollars into mining gear.New projects though will probably not choose proof of work anymore as their consensus mechanism as it is just not fitting in todays mentality where the protection of the environment and the climate change are such big topics in the media.

comments.author: Tytanowy Janusz
comments.body: Great. top 2. But do we need more than 1 super decentralized undestructable network? Do we need more POW coins then bitcoin? Quote from: Jackl87 on September 16, 2022, 03:00:11 PMIn general i think that the time of Proof-of-Work coin is coming to an end slowly but surely. Bitcoin will of course be an exception from that because i highly doubt, that they will also move to proof of stake in the future because bitcoin mining is just way to big of a business i think with mining farms in China having invested millions and millions of dollars into mining gear.It was the same with eth. It was also a "way to big of a business". Next GPU minable coin after ETH is now ETC with only 2% of marketcap. Means that 95% of gpu computing power will not find alternative and will have to dump hardware on gamers witch will most likely not absorb it.

comments.author: el kaka22
comments.body: I am pretty sure that we are going to see doge go down eventually, people are overvaluing doge right now because there was a point where Elon pumped it and even after he stopped people still kept on holding it and trading it and there is this huge doge community that got established, so much so that we have other coins and tokens that are meme focused and they are still doing fine too, so it is big enough hype to keep it going.But, ever since the start of this hype I keep saying that it will die down eventually, and it hasn't so far but it will happen. PoW or not, it is a bad coin to invest into and it shouldn't really be in the top ten to start off with.

The announcement however did not seem to have any major effect on the price of Dogecoin.ummm what?? Bitcoin will always be PoW. What are you even talking about transitioning?Dogecoin I suppose could move to PoS but its a silly memecoin so it doesn't matter whether its PoW or PoS, it'll continue being a silly memecoin no matter what consensus protocol it uses. And Bitcoin is the only PoW crypto that matters so it doesn't really matter what is 2nd in hash power.

comments.author: thecodebear
comments.body: Quote from: el kaka22 on September 16, 2022, 05:44:24 PMI am pretty sure that we are going to see doge go down eventually, people are overvaluing doge right now because there was a point where Elon pumped it and even after he stopped people still kept on holding it and trading it and there is this huge doge community that got established, so much so that we have other coins and tokens that are meme focused and they are still doing fine too, so it is big enough hype to keep it going.But, ever since the start of this hype I keep saying that it will die down eventually, and it hasn't so far but it will happen. PoW or not, it is a bad coin to invest into and it shouldn't really be in the top ten to start off with.Yeah Dogecoin will never get close to its 2021 high of 77 cents or whatever it was. Dogecoin got popular because Musk was stupidly promoting it a ton and happened to be doing that during a bull market when a ton of people come into the market not having a clue what they are doing. Now Dogecoin is a known thing and Musk has much less ability to pump it and people are far less likely to blindly buy into it since the big Musk pump already happened in the past. Now that 2021 Musk pump is over Doge will continue to fall toward zero against Bitcoin, just like essentially every other crypto does.
